data.title: Track & Field, Cross Country
data.meta_description: Bobby Colantonio Jr.Throws - Colantonio Jr. Top Marks Accolades Holds the UA indoor school record in the weight throw (24.14m | 79-2.75) Holds the No. 2 hamm...
data.text:
Colantonio Jr. Top Marks

Accolades

Holds the UA indoor school record in the weight throw (24.14m | 79-2.75)

Holds the No. 2 hammer-throw mark in UA outdoor history (72.59m | 238-2)

NCAA Weight Throw Champion (2022)

All-American, weight throw (2019, 2021, 2022, 2023)

All-American, hammer (2019, 2021)

SEC Hammer Throw Champion (2022)

SEC Weight Throw Champion (2022, 2023)

Outdoor First Team All-SEC (2022)

Outdoor Second Team All-SEC (2023)

Indoor First Team All-SEC (2022, 2023)

2022-23

Outdoor

Named an honorable mention All-American after his performance at the National Championships

Qualified for Nationals via a seventh-place finish in the hammer throw at the NCAA East Prelims

Outdoor Second Team All-SEC

Won bronze in the hammer throw at the SEC Championships

Indoor

Finished as national runner-up in the weight throw at the National Championships, earning first team All-America honors

Won the SEC weight throw title for the second consecutive year with a mark of 23.71 meters, earning first team All-SEC recognition

2021-22

Outdoor

Won the SEC hammer throw title with a career-best 72.59 meters, ranking him second all-time at UA. and earning First Team All-SEC honors

Took second in the hammer throw at the NCAA East Preliminary, advancing him to the NCAA Championships

Indoor

Won the 2022 NCAA Indoor Weight Throw Championship with a mark of 23.60 meters

Four of his six efforts in the weight throw at the NCAA Championships were better than the best mark by the second-place finisher

Undefeated in the weight throw in 2022, including winning the NCAA and SEC titles

Posted a career-best and UA record 24.15m, which ranks him 8th all-time collegiately

Of the 20 throws over 23 meters in NCAA competition in 2022, Colantonio produced 14

Won the SEC weight throw title with a mark of 23.09 meters, more than 1.5 meters better than the rest of the field

Only thrower in the SEC Indoors field to post a toss of more than 21.60 meters, bettering that distance four times, including two in the 23+ range

Competed in the weight throw with a season, career, and school-record toss of 24.15 meters at the UAB Blazer Invitational, ranking him eighth all-time in collegiate history

Earned SEC Field Athlete of the week two times during the 2022 indoor season

2020-21

Outdoor

Qualified for the NCAA Championships in the hammer throw, where he finished 15th with a throw of 69.53 meters

Second Team All-American in the hammer throw

Finished fifth in the hammer throw at the SEC Championships, throwing a mark of 68.41m (224-5)

Recorded the top collegiate mark in hammer throw at the Crimson Tide Invitational with a mark of 69.55m

Opened the outdoor season with a silver medal in hammer throw at the Pepsi Florida Relays with a mark of 68.12m

Indoor

Traveled to the NCAA Indoor Championships and was awarded fifth place in weight throw with a mark of 22.27m

First Team All-American in the weight throw

Awarded silver in weight throw (22.40m) at the SEC Indoor Track and Field Championships

Won the weight throw event (22.54m) at the Tyson Invitational

Opened the season with a second place finish in weight throw at the South Carolina Invitational with a mark of 22.07m

2019-20

Indoor

Traveled with the Tide to College Station, Texas to compete in the weight throw event at the SEC Indoor Track and Field Championships.

Won the weight throw event at the New Mexico Collegiate Classic with a mark of 76-6.50 (23.33m).

Finished 1st in the men’s weight throw, clearing a mark of 77-2.75 (23.54m) and recording a new personal best. He also broke the tide’s school record which was previously held by Daniel Haugh (75-8.00 / 23.10m).

Finished 1st in the weight throw (21.83m) to start the indoor season at the UAB Blazer Invitational.

2018-19

Outdoor

Finished 2nd in the hammer throw at the LSU Invitational with a mark of 223-9 (68.20m)

Finished 1st in the hammer throw at the Crimson Tide Invitational with a mark of 222-6 (67.82m)

Finished 4th in the hammer throw at the Battle on the Bayou with a mark of 219-11 (67.03m)

Finished 8th in the hammer throw at the Florida Relays with a mark of 218-10 (66.71m)

Indoor

Finished 10th in the weight throw at the NCAA Indoor Championship with a mark of 68-11 (21.01m)

Finished 7th in the weight throw at the SEC Indoor Championship with a mark of 68-2 (20.78m)

Finished 4th in the weight throw at the Music City Challenge with a mark of 70-11 (21.63m)

Finished 1st in the weight throw at the Carolina Challenge with a mark of 69-2 (21.09m)

Finished 1st in the weight throw at the Bob Pollock Invitational with a mark of 69-6 ¾ (21.20m)

Finished 2nd in the weight throw at the Vanderbilt Invitational with a mark of 67-0 ¾ (20.44m)

Finished 3rd in the weight throw at the Blazer Invite with a mark of 69-4 (21.13m)

Prep Highlights

Two-time U.S. junior national champion, three-time junior All-American, two-time New Balance Nationals champion and four-time state champion in the hammer throw at Barrington High School

Set New England and Rhode Island records in the 5-kilo and 6-kilo hammer throw

Became the youngest U.S. junior champion in the hammer throw when he won the event as a 17-year-old at the 2015 USA Track & Field Junior National Championships

Finished fifth in the hammer throw at the 2015 World Youth Championships in Cali, Colombia

Finished seventh in the hammer throw at the 2015 Pan Am Junior Athletics Championships in Edmonton, Alberta

Also competed at the 2016 U20 World Championships in Bydgoszcz, Poland

Member of the football team at Barrington High School and competed in weightlifting and powerlifting as a prep

Personal Information

Son of Robert Colantonio and Donna Allyn

Father, Robert, was a hammer thrower on the 1979 USA junior national team

Born May 18, 1998

Majoring in exercise science
